section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The low beams are switched on and off automatically depending on the ambient brightness, for example in tunnels, in twilight or if there is precipitation.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: A blue sky with the sun low on the horizon can cause the lights to be turned on.
If the low beams are switched on manually, the automatic headlight control is deactivated.

section.title: Activate automatic headlight control

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button on the light switch element.

section.paragraph: The LED in the button lights up.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The indicator light in the instrument cluster is illuminated when the low beams are switched on.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: The automatic headlight control cannot replace your personal judgment of lighting conditions.
For example, the sensors are unable to detect fog or hazy weather. In these situations, turn the lights on manually.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the steering-wheel angle and other parameters, the laser high beams follow the course of the road.

section.title: Anticipating light control
section.paragraph: The high beams already pivot to the subsequent driving direction before driving into or exiting a curve.

section.title: S-bend lights
section.paragraph: The high beams are kept as straight as possible when driving through S-curves.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The variable light distribution enables better illumination of the road.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The light distribution is adjusted depending on speed and navigation data if necessary.

section.paragraph: The lighting area of the low beams is extended at the sides.

section.paragraph: The headlight range of the low beams is expanded.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: In tight curves, for instance on mountainous roads or when turning, an additional cornering light is switched on that lights up the inside of the curve when the vehicle is moving below a certain speed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The cornering light is automatically switched on depending on the steering-wheel angle or, where applicable, the use of turn signals.
When driving in reverse, the cornering lights may be automatically switched on regardless of the steering-wheel angle.

section.title: Hairpin lights
section.paragraph: The cornering light is additionally switched on before driving on hairpin curves.

section.title: Roundabout light
section.paragraph: Shortly before the vehicle enters a roundabout, the cornering light is switched on both sides. The road margin is illuminated better. Shortly after the vehicle leaves the roundabout, the cornering light is switched off again on both sides.

section.title: Adaptive headlight range control
section.paragraph: The adaptive headlight range control feature balances out acceleration and braking processes as well as the vehicle load conditions in order to avoid blinding oncoming traffic.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Automatic High Beam Assistant detects other road users early on and automatically switches the high beams on or off depending on the traffic situation.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The Automatic High Beam Assistant ensures that the high beams are switched on, whenever the traffic situation allows. In the low speed range, the high beams are not switched on by the system.
The system responds to light from oncoming traffic and traffic driving ahead of you, and to ambient lighting, for instance in towns and cities.
The high beams can be switched on and off manually at any time.

In the equipment version with glare-free Automatic High Beam Assistant, the high beams are not switched off for oncoming vehicles or vehicles driving ahead of you. Only the areas that blind oncoming traffic or traffic driving ahead are dimmed. In this case, the blue indicator light will stay on.
Depending on the equipment: if the headlights are converted, the Automatic High Beam Assistant may only be available in a limited manner.

section.title: Sensitivity of the Automatic High Beam Assistant
General information
section.paragraph: The sensitivity of the Automatic High Beam Assistant can be adjusted.

warning.paragraph: If adjustments have been made or the sensitivity has been modified, oncoming traffic may be momentarily blinded. There is a risk of accident. If adjustments have been made and the sensitivity has been modified, make sure that oncoming traffic is not momentarily blinded. Switch off the high beams manually if required.

item.paragraph: Setting at standstill only.
Drive-ready state is switched on.
Light is turned off.

section.title: Increasing sensitivity
section.paragraph: Push the turn signal lever to the front for approximately 10 seconds.
A Check Control message is displayed. The system responds more sensitively.

section.title: Resetting the sensitivity
section.paragraph: Push the turn signal lever to the front again for approx. 10 seconds or switch off the drive-ready state.
The sensitivity of the Automatic High Beam Assistant is reset to the factory settings.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: The Automatic High Beam Assistant cannot replace the driver's personal judgment of when to use the high beams. In situations that require this, therefore dim manually.
The system is not fully functional in the following situations, and driver intervention may be necessary:

item.paragraph: In very unfavorable weather conditions, such as fog or heavy precipitation.
When detecting poorly-lit road users such as pedestrians, cyclists, horseback riders and wagons; when driving close to train or ship traffic; or at animal crossings.
In tight curves, on hilltops or in depressions, in crossing traffic or half-obscured oncoming traffic on highways.
In poorly-lit towns and cities or in the presence of highly reflective signs.
When the windshield in front of the interior mirror is fogged up, dirty or covered with stickers, etc.
When the windshield in front of the interior mirror is fogged up, dirty or covered with stickers.

overview.overview-text: Switch on when view is poor

warning.paragraph: The rear fog lights are a lighting system that is helpful for preventing rear-end collisions with poor view due to fog, etc. With clear view, the lights may blind the traffic following behind. There is a risk of accident. Do not switch the rear fog lights on with clear view.
